subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do what you all are doing,
author: Rj
full_text:
--0-123234573-1241457226=:12302
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Frank =E2=80=93 I think I disagree with you here.=C2=A0 Science is not just=
 about the evidence, it=E2=80=99s about the entire process, including how t=
he evidence is collected and how (and by whom) it is interpreted.=C2=A0 Thi=
s is why a valuable tool in the scientific arsenal is the double (and tripl=
e) blind study.=C2=A0 It attempts to remove the often uncontrollable subjec=
tivity inherent in all people, even scientists!=C2=A0 Science uses this tec=
hnique to help keep even itself as honest as possible.=C2=A0 So if you are =
finding that the evidence is being ignored, the reason may not be the evide=
nce itself (no matter how compelling). It may very well be the manner in wh=
ich it is collected, and interpreted: all at least as important as the audi=
o itself.

EVP=E2=80=99s are perfectly allowed to throw monkey wrenches, an=
d even kitchen sinks into scientific theories and accepted dogmas: but only=
 if they follow science=E2=80=99s rules.=C2=A0 It=E2=80=99s like trying to =
put a new medicine on the market with claims that it destroys accepted dogm=
as: but, if the testing has not been rigorous and up to accepted medical st=
andards, its hard to blame consumers for being doubtful of its claims.

Sci=
ence is not magic: it is a simple process really, but it forces a claim to =
really be solidly confirmed. It seems to me that, while EVP research has it=
s toe in the water of scientific methodology (it is making observations, co=
llecting evidence, and making theories), it seems to be obsessed on that ph=
ase of science, and not on the hard part: designing and conducting objectiv=
e tests to conform or dismiss the theories.=C2=A0 It seems that so many peo=
ple are having so much fun with their audio devices and results, that they =
are maybe afraid of taking it to the next step of serious testing, maybe be=
cause of the risk this testing could destroy their fun.

But they should ma=
ybe consider it might NOT destroy their fun, but instead that next phase of=
 testing may be just what the doctors ordered to bring EVP into mainline sc=
ience: real, science-based testing.=C2=A0 I fear the people accepted as the=
 real experts and pioneers in this field (like you Frank) will never get an=
y acknowledgement of their achievements unless they have are able to move i=
nto this next phase.

Science wants you to piss on its fire, Frank.=C2=A0 B=
ut you have to go where the fire is.=C2=A0=C2=A0 And the way there is throu=
gh the entire scientific method, not just the early fun parts, but the hard=
 testing parts.=C2=A0 But I understand how difficult that prospect can be, =
and that it would take your focus off the part you seem to like best (exper=
imenting with the equipment).=C2=A0 If you are unable to bring yourself to =
the testing phase, it might be worth looking at partnering up with others w=
ho would focus on that part for you?=C2=A0 I think a very dynamic team of p=
eople could be formed with you focused on the technology creation, and they=
 focused on the more mundane aspects of rigorous blind study testing.=C2=A0=
 Do you think that would be valuable to you, and to the field of EVP studie=
s?
=C2=A0


--- On Mon, 5/4/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> =
wrote:

oogroups.com

           =
 
            


      
      =C2=A0It's not that it can't be proven, it's =
that all evidence is deemed unacceptable- -a convinient way to make uncompf=
ortable facts go away.=C2=A0 The fact is=C2=A0 most of the EVP evidence pre=
tty much contradicts, or at least throws a monkey wrench in many so called =
scientific theories, and accepted dogma. Even spiritualists don't accept th=
at there's a technology=C2=A0for spirit communication, who needs a medium w=
hen you've got box?

=C2=A0
=C2=A0To me, it seems science has done little o=
ver the last 500 years except proclaim themsles the worlds only experts and=
 source of all knowledge. All technological advancement is made by people t=
rying an idea to see what works, and running with it, not waiting for peer =
review BS to tell her it doesn't work. Science is a bunch of fat old men si=
tting around a fire place in over stuffed chairs telling each other how sma=
rt they are! They don't want anyone pissing on the fire!

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Fran=
k-S


On Mon, May 4, 2009 at 9:20 AM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieg=
h ostresearch. com> wrote:









You will never be able to prove your me=
thods scientifically, so why even try to argue with them? Even if you were =
able to, they probably still wouldn't believe it.
=C2=A0
IMO, who cares? Al=
l that matters is that you are getting something out of it. Besides, maybe =
it isn't meant to be understood by certain people. I have always held the o=
pinion that we will never scientifically prove anything we do in the parano=
rmal field, and I think that is no accident. I think some people will never=
 get anything out of it, while others will excel in their knowledge, but it=
 will be all very personal.

=C2=A0
It's all about what constitutes enough=
=C2=A0proof for you personally. You have to go with your gut on what is tru=
e spirit communication, and what isn't. If no one ever agrees with you, so =
what?

=C2=A0
April



=C2=A0

bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do what you all are doing,=





=C2=A0I was just sayin'!=C2=A0 So why would anyone in this field compl=
etely ignore methods that work, irregardless of whether science accpts it? =
That's the thing, say anything and I'm the one being negative. Question the=
se other experts and I'm being negative--on and on. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Same old=
 story--don't accept the evidence, don't accept that that someone-like me-d=
oes in fact at least understand what conditions to create to make these com=
munications possible. Yet y'all wonder why I have a case of the ass all the=
 time. All the pompus self proclaimed egotisical little dweebs out there ch=
asing the damn fame and fortune--not facts.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I have gotten so =
much friggn'=C2=A0voices that can't be explained as anything but spirits/en=
tity communication- -not good enough! 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0You hear that crap(any =
proof...)=C2=A0from every scientist/debunker- -well if the evidence was the=
re we'd be the first to celibrate it-yeah right, rihgt after they burned, b=
urried, and debunked it. There is more than enough evidence--all of it is i=
gnored.=C2=A0=C2=A0

=C2=A0
=C2=A0The stuff is simple-provide something for=
 the enitities to make their voices out of and they will speak, no friggin'=
 mystery, no magic, no secret tecnology, no high priest(ess) needed. 
=C2=
=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S

=C2=A0
On Sun, May 3, 2009 at 7:56 PM, itcdeadpeople <IT=
Cdeadpeople@ aol.com> wrote:








Frank, I think you misunderstood or mi=
sread something somewhere. The AAEVP/Sarah Estep Research Fund is not for A=
AEVP to do the research, it's for them to fund OUTSIDE organizations for TH=
EIR scientific research on the study of EVP. The Windbridge Institute recei=
ved some of this sponsor money for what they called "Real-time EVP Conversa=
tions: A Pilot Study." The method for this communication was *not* based on=
 radio sweep, nor traditional methods, so it's not based on what I assume m=
any people here are doing. And in fact, it *was* based on the creations of =
someone outside of the USA, so I'm a little confused as to why all the host=
ility toward AAEVP for putting up the money.


Sadly, radio sweep methods d=
on't, and may not for a long time, get the respect of the scientific commun=
ity that it deserves (then again, seems no form of EVP does), but at least =
this current research is a step in the right direction. I hope, when Windbr=
idge concludes their study, that it will support the notion that there is a=
pparent communication formed in ways that cannot be explained by currently =
known and understood laws of nature. THAT alone, in my opinion, would be a =
big plus for all ITC communities, regardless of the method from which that =
communication was received. What's the old saying? "It takes but one white =
crow to prove all crows are not black." Any proof, derived from any EVP met=
hod, would be greatly welcomed as far as I'm concerned.


Margaret

<p>Frank, I think you misunderstood or misread something somewhere. The=
 AAEVP/Sarah Estep Research Fund is not for AAEVP to do the research, it's =
for them to fund OUTSIDE organizations for THEIR scientific research on the=
 study of EVP. The Windbridge Institute received some of this sponsor money=
 for what they called "Real-time EVP Conversations: A Pilot Study." The met=
hod for this communication was *not* based on radio sweep, nor traditional =
methods, so it's not based on what I assume many people here are doing. And=
 in fact, it *was* based on the creations of someone outside of the USA, so=
 I'm a little confused as to why all the hostility toward AAEVP for putting=
 up the money.<br>
<br>Sadly, radio sweep methods don't, and may not for a =
long time, get the respect of the scientific community that it deserves (th=
en again, seems no form of EVP does), but at least this current research is=
 a step in the right direction. I hope, when Windbridge concludes their stu=
dy, that it will support the notion that there is apparent communication fo=
rmed in ways that cannot be explained by currently known and understood law=
s of nature. THAT alone, in my opinion, would be a big plus for all ITC com=
munities, regardless of the method from which that communication was receiv=
ed. What's the old saying? "It takes but one white crow to prove all crows =
are not black." Any proof, derived from any EVP method, would be greatly we=
lcomed as far as I'm concerned.<br>
<br>Margaret
